group_1.narration: But she has lost sight of the light and is@unable to escape the world of darkness.
When Corbeau put La Pucelle to sleep,@Liz was elsewhere and was able@to avoid being dragged into the dream.
In order to save La Pucelle, Liz stole@a set of candles from Corbeau.
She used them to gain entry to@La Pucelle's dream.

group_1.textRight: Liz was going in and out of the dream@like us?!

group_1.textLeft: That explains it.
She would disappear sometimes, just like us.
She must've been outside of the dream.

group_1.textRight: Why was Liz keeping that a secret?

group_1.narration: Use of the candles comes with a rule.
Break this rule, and your body will be@engulfed by the dream Labyrinth.

group_1.textRight: That's why she wasn't able to tell us@anything!

group_1.textCenter: I'm sorry. I can't say right now.
If I do, everything will come to an end.

group_1.textLeft: This is the first I'm hearing of any rules.
That information must've been on one of@the missing pages.

group_1.textRight: Liz and Corbeau may have followed those@rules but...
We talked about the grimoire after using@the candles!

group_1.narration: The two of you are safe.
Liz relayed to me that@your bodies are in the future.
The Labyrinth that has trapped La Pucelle@should no longer exist in your time.

group_1.textLeft: Ahh, that's why the rules don't apply to@you two.
You're even more important than I thought!
Everything is clear now!
Liz was the first to know that this was@Darc's dream.
She worked with Pernelle to try and save@her.

group_1.textRight: But she couldn't talk to anyone about it.
And she entrusted the rest to us, in case@anything happened to her.

group_1.textLeft: But if Liz is safe...
Why haven't we seen her again?

group_1.narration: She was severely wounded and vanished@into the shadows, but she has healed.
However, she is lost within the space@between dream and reality.
Because La Pucelle's guiding light@has disappeared.

group_1.textLeft: Now I understand.
Don't you remember? We were lost too.

group_1.textCenter: Keep answering when we call out, and we'll@find our way to you!

group_1.textLeft: Uh, okay?!
I don't really understand, but I'll try to@help!
Liz must be going through the same thing.

group_1.textRight: We had been heading toward Darc's light so@we'd keep going in the right direction.
But then Darc, the one who was dreaming,@lost hope...
Her guiding light disappeared, so Liz@couldn't reenter the dream and got lost!

group_1.textLeft: Exactly.
So to help Liz, we should save Darc first.
We need to let her know that Liz is alive.
Then her hope should shine again.
Does that sound like it could work,@Pernelle?

group_1.narration: Yes! Please save La Pucelle and Liz.
I have one final request of you.
―Pernelle―@If you see Darc, please give this to her.
―Pernelle―@If she lifts this sword, the light of hope@that guides Liz will shine even brighter.

group_1.textLeft: Yes. We know what we have to do now.
